Israel strikes Gaza arms site after deadly night of bombing leaves over 100 dead
subhed: Israel said it struck an arms depot in northern Gaza hours after the deadliest night of bombing since the start of a US-brokered truce, warning it would keep operating against what it called 'imminent threats' despite mounting international calls to preserve the ceasefire.

title: French museums security under scrutiny in the Sénat after Louvre heist
subhed: A roundtable organized by the culture committee on October 29 highlighted outdated surveillance camera systems at the Louvre and the need for a comprehensive plan in response to a rise in burglaries.

title: 'By partnering with Shein, a symbol of globalized fast fashion, the BHV department store has muddled its own narrative'
subhed: The decision could have significant economic consequences for the Parisian department store at a time when public opinion has become a global strategic issue for companies, say communications specialists Céline Chanvin and Anne Zuccarelli, managing directors at the Vianova agency.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhed: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

subhed: Around France, agents of the CAF, a government body that provides welfare benefits, deal with difficult situations as social precarity increases.

title: Romania's new 'National Cathedral,' the largest in the Orthodox world, sparks controversy
subhed: After 15 years of construction, the People's Salvation Cathedral in Bucharest opened its doors to the public on Sunday. A source of pride for many Romanians, it has also drawn criticism for its cost, which was largely funded by public money.
